title: Six months on; has NPP govt. walked the talk?
byline: Six months have lapsed after the formation of the National People’s Power (NPP) government led by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake. He ascended to office after the victory at the Presidential Election on September 21, 2024. For a government elected for five years, six months period is not a long time to assess its performance in full.

title: Sri Lanka Rugby’s Last Chance
byline: Despite a resounding on-field victory over Malaysia and a triumphant return to Asia Rugby’s top tier, Sri Lanka Rugby (SLR) finds itself at a perilous crossroads - one that could undo all recent sporting progress unless urgent governance reforms are enacted.

title: NPP fulfilled key promise to reform political culture: General Secretary
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has fulfilled the most expected and key promise of changing the political culture in the country, where perks and privileges of politicians, including the President, have been cut down while putting a stop to fraud and corruption, NPP General Secretary Dr. Nihal Abeysinghe said.

title: Govt’s unrealistic promises will lead to downfall of nation: Wajira
byline: The government’s action of giving unrealistic promises and working against the framework provided by 15 legislations, which were enacted by the previous regime, will lead to the downfall of the nation, United National Party (UNP) Chairman Wajira Abeywardena said yesterday.

title: Cybersecurity in focus as police launch specialised crimes unit
byline: Sri Lanka’s Police Department has established a dedicated Cybercrimes Unit, in response to a sharp rise in online offences, driven by the country’s accelerated shift towards digital transactions.

title: Great mismatch between promises and delivery: SLPP
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) said that there is a great mismatch between what the government promised before the elections and delivered after.

title: Govt. confused and coming up with utter falsehoods: Harsha
byline: Whilst the government seemed to be totally confused when it comes to handling the economy, it has been successful in uttering falsehoods to the gullible public, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Dr. Harsha de Silva said yesterday.

title: Economy on the mend but crisis scars still show - WB on Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka has been commended for its quicker-than-expected recovery from the worst economic crisis since independence. However, the World Bank has echoed the growing concerns, cautioning that the island nation is still not entirely out of the woods.

title: 1Q exports top US $ 4bn
byline: Sri Lanka’s export sector maintained its upward trajectory in March 2025, pushing the total first-quarter earnings to US $ 4.21 billion, up 5.87 percent year-on-year (YoY), the data from the Export Development Board (EDB) showed.

title: Special train services to Kandy suspended until further notice
byline: The special train services arranged for the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic at the Sri Dalada Maligawa have been suspended until further notice, the Railways Department announced.

title: Apple, Meta fined as EU presses ahead with tech probes
byline: Apple (AAPL.O), opens new tab was fined 500 million euros ($570 million) on Wednesday and Meta (META.O), opens new tab 200 million euros, as European Union antitrust regulators handed out the first sanctions under landmark legislation aimed at curbing the power of Big Tech.

title: Feb 9 islandwide power outage caused by low system stability
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has confirmed that the primary cause of the nationwide power outage on February 9, 2025, was low system stability, technically referred to as low ’system inertia’, resulting from an exceptionally high contribution of solar photovoltaic (PV) power at the time.

title: India summons top Pakistani diplomat after Kashmir attack on tourists
byline: India has summoned the top Pakistani diplomat in New Delhi, local media reported on Thursday, a day after it announced measures to downgrade ties with Islamabad as relations between the nuclear-armed rivals plummeted following a deadly militant attack in Kashmir.

title: Main suspect arrested in Dan Priyasad shooting
byline: The main suspect in the fatal shooting of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) local council candidate Dan Priyasad has been arrested.

title: India downgrades Pakistan ties after attack on Kashmir tourists
byline: India has announced a raft of measures to downgrade its ties to Pakistan, a day after armed men killed 26 people in the tourist town of Pahalgam in the disputed region Kashmir.

title: FactCheck.lk responds to Ranil on EPF losses due to debt restructuring
byline: FactCheck.lk has responded to the feedback from the office of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe regarding fact-check published in the Daily Mirror newspaper on March 21, 2025.

title: Colombo High Court sentences man to death for 2015 murder
byline: Colombo High Court Judge Adithya Patabendi sentenced Patrick Krishnanandan to death after convicting him of murdering a woman at a lodge on Hetti Veediya in 2015.

title: Police to check individuals wearing helmets while off bikes
byline: Police officers had been directed to inspect individuals wearing helmets while not riding motorcycles, especially if they appear suspicious, Police said.

title: Chamari to lead SL Women in Tri-Nation Series
byline: Chamari Atapattu will lead the 17-member Sri Lanka Women’s Cricket Squad for the Women’s Tri-Nation ODI Series involving India and South Africa and scheduled to be played from April 27.

title: Woman dies while waiting in Kandy queues to venerate Sacred Tooth Relic: Police
byline: A woman died due to a suspected heart attack while waiting in queues in Kandy for several days to venerate the Sacred Tooth Relic at the Sri Dalada Maligawa, the Kandy police said.

title: Evening thundershowers likely in Kandy during coming days
byline: There is a possibility of thundershowers occurring in the Kandy district during the evening hours over the coming days, particularly after 2 p.m., Meteorology Department Deputy Director Meril Mendis said.

title: Former CCD Director surrenders over Weligama shooting
byline: Former Director of the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD), ASP Nevil Silva, surrendered to the Matara Magistrate’s Court in connection with the shooting incident near the W15 Hotel in Weligama in 2023.

title: China sends Boeing planes back to US over tariffs
byline: China has sent back planes it ordered from the US in its latest retaliation over Trump tariffs, the boss of aircraft maker Boeing has said.

title: April 26 declared national day of mourning for Pope’s death
byline: The government has declared April 26, 2025 as a national day of mourning in view of the passing away of Pope Francis.

title: Sri Lanka hopeful of reaching staff level agreement with IMF on fourth review: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka will be able to reach a staff level agreement with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) on the fourth review under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) arrangement within this week, Minister of Labour Anil Jayantha Fernando said today.

title: Colombo court orders CID to expedite Ella Odyssey probe
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today informed the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court that it is closely analyzing telephone records and financial transactions as part of ongoing investigations into the alleged Ella Odyssey ticket reselling scam.

title: Quasi Judge remanded for bribery allegation in divorce case
byline: A Quasi-Judicial Officer serving in Kandy was today ordered to be remanded till April 29 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Harshana Kekunawela, following allegations that he solicited a bribe of Rs. 200,000 to expedite a divorce ruling.

title: Sufficient crowd gathered in Kandy for remaining days: Police
byline: A sufficient crowd has already gathered in Kandy town to pay homage to the Sacred Tooth Relic for the remaining days, the Kandy police said.

title: Indian nabbed with Kush worth Rs. 53 Mn at BIA
byline: Sri Lanka Customs this morning arrested an Indian national trying to smuggle in Cannabis variety Kush worth over Rs.53 million from Bangkok, at the Bandaranaike International Airport.

title: US Reciprocal tariff revision talks - Is government making false claim on deliberations with US, questions RW
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe today questioned the claim made by the government on a successful deliberation with the US on the Reciprocal tariff on imports.

title: Health officials urge people to carry medical records during Sri Dalada Wandanawa
byline: Health authorities have alerted the people with health risks to carry their medical reports while visiting Kandy for the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic, the Health Promotion Bureau said.

title: Record number of complaints related to LG polls
byline: A record 155 fresh complaints related to the upcoming Local Government elections were reported within a single day, marking the highest daily figure recorded since March 20.

title: Pakistan halts trade and India revokes visas as retaliatory measures ramp up after Kashmir killings
byline: Pakistan has halted trade and India has revoked visas as tit-for-tat retaliatory actions ramp up between the two powers after an attack in Kashmir that killed 26 people.

title: Market ends on slightly positive note amid thin volumes and mixed sentiment
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange concluded today’s session with a modest gain, driven by selective buying interest amid subdued market activity. Investor sentiment remained mixed, reflecting cautious optimism as market participants await clearer signals for direction.

title: Former Uva Deputy Financial Secretary granted bail
byline: The former Deputy Chief Financial Secretary of the Uva Provincial Council, Sumithra Silva, was released on bail today in connection with the alleged financial misappropriation case involving MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake.

title: Four die in Kandy during Sacred Tooth Relic visit, says Hospital Director
byline: Four people who visited Kandy to pay homage to the Sacred Tooth Relic and for official duties have died,  Director National Hospital, Kandy Dr. Iresha Fernando said.

title: Schools close for Local Government elections for two days
byline: The Education Ministry has decided to close schools on May 5 as notified in the Commissioner General of Elections’ letter dated April 19, in view of the Local Government elections scheduled for May 6.

title: India suspends visa services for Pakistani nationals with immediate effect
byline: In continuation of the decisions made by the Cabinet Committee on Security in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack, the Government of India has decided to suspend visa services to Pakistani nationals with immediate effect, said MEA on Thursday.

title: Avoid visiting Kandy amid large crowds: Kandy District Secretary urges public
byline: Kandy District Secretary Indika Udawatte today urged the public to avoid visiting Kandy for the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic until further notice, due to the large number of devotees currently waiting in queues.
